newsitem.title: USA: Bonneville offers peak, off-peak power for Friday.
newsitem.headline: Bonneville offers peak, off-peak power for Friday.

text.p: The Bonneville Power Administration (BPA) offered both peak and off-peak power for Friday delivery, the agency said Thursday.
BPA had offered no surplus power for Tuesday through Thursday pre-schedulings.
Firm power during peak demand hours (0600-2200 PST) was offered at $10.00 per megawatt hour (MWh) for both Northwest and California-Oregon border (COB) deliveries.
Firm power during light load hours, limited to 500 megawatt hours, was offered at $18.75 (Northwest) and $19.75 (COB).
Non-firm power during light load hours was offered at $10.25 per MWh for all deliveries, while peak power was offered at $19.00 (Northwest) and $20.00 (COB).
